instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3787: What is 820-3787? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.820-3332: What is 820-3332? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.R7121: What is R7121? Current sense resistor between charger current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H around 4v, quarter fan spin, or battery not charging..
definitions.BUTTON_DISABLE: What is BUTTON_DISABLE? BUTTON_DISABLE disables the trackpad when SMC_LID is below 0.5v and the system believes the lid is closed. .
definitions.U5701: What is U5701? this is the keyboard controller chip that takes the keyboard and trackpad input and turns it into a USB device signal for the machine to process. If replacing a keyboard doesnâ€™t fix an issue with keys not typing, check all traces between keyboard connector and this IC. This chip has programming so it must be replaced from a similar, ideally identical board. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no trackpad no keyboard after liquid damage
threads.message:
hi friends.

I just have an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> here it had a hole in the board near <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> and no power on

I replaced <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> and soldered the missing traces. After that it worked, Trackpad working, keyboard wrote what it want. Then with a new Akku I noticed that It consumed 4-6A, after that I limited the curent to 3,5

I found that <RESISTOR>R7121</RESISTOR>/22 are bad. After replacing current was normal (about 3.4A not rising anymore)

Now I found that the damaged <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> burned a hole in the Keyboard cable until the metal of the keyboard.

So I replaced the keyboard. But still the same problem.

I tryed another mainboard in the same case, now keyboard and trackpad is working well.


I dont know why but the keyboard and trackpad is not working anymore.

I found on J4800  Pin 22 and 18 has power,
Pin 20 <SIGNAL>Z2_CLKIN</SIGNAL> nothing

So I checked U 4801 and found in diode mode Pin 23-28 nothing.

I replaced <CHIP>U4801</CHIP>, Diode mode all pins ok now.J4800 Pin 20 has clock now. But no trackpad ( I disconnected the keyboard and only try to get trackpad until now)

then I found in the forum that duke wrote <CHIP>U4801</CHIP> needs only power and usb and as to show up in the osx. I tryed with a good mainboard first. internal keyboard and trackpad is shown up.

with the problem board it shows nothing. In diode mode I get on <RESISTOR>R4801</RESISTOR>/02 both sides the same reading (good and bad board)

<RESISTOR>R4801</RESISTOR> has 3.13V, <RESISTOR>R4802</RESISTOR> 0V. On the good board it has 0V as well

The <CHIP>U4801</CHIP> is programmed. I took it from a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>. Pinout is the same. may be there is no comunication?

External keyboard and mouse is working good

Need some help please

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no trackpad no keyboard after liquid damage
threads.message:
First of all, get <CHIP>U4801</CHIP> from donor board same model.
Could work, or not, from 3332; nobody can confirm that 100%, unless already tried that.
Be sure it receives correct VDD, pins 22/49.
Check if both <RESISTOR>R4801</RESISTOR>/02 are good.
Also confirm 0V at <SIGNAL>BUTTON_DISABLE</SIGNAL> signal.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no trackpad no keyboard after liquid damage
threads.message:
<RESISTOR>R4801</RESISTOR> has 24.6 Ohm
<RESISTOR>R4802</RESISTOR> has 24.2 Ohm

means good I think.<SIGNAL>BUTTON_DISABLE</SIGNAL> signal has 0V
<CHIP>U4801</CHIP> PIN 22/49 have 3.3V

I just have no donor here to test that, I have a good working board only. I will check that.
The Pinout is the same, I tryed the board with an mid 2012 retina trackpad but no way.
If there is a different then has the <CHIP>U1100</CHIP> a problem in comunication with USB, but USB should be the same protocol.

For me is intresting that I have on <RESISTOR>R4802</RESISTOR> 0V also on the good board. I expected there signals like on <RESISTOR>R4801</RESISTOR>. Or is that because its differntial and no comunication, means one line has 3.13V, high pegel and the other has low pegel?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no trackpad no keyboard after liquid damage
threads.message:
ok, when I look in the schematics, its 2 different things

<CHIP>U5701</CHIP> (3332 board) and ___U4801 (3787 board)
CY8C24794_____________ CY8C24794
MLF____________________ MLF[COLOR=#B22222][U]-1[/U][/COLOR]
(SYM-VER2) ____________(SYM-VER2)
337S2983 _______________[COLOR=#FF0000]337S4426[/COLOR]

So I will look for a <CHIP>U4801</CHIP> from same donor board
